about_the_game:
Terminal 81R is an indie game that combines simulation, adventure, mystery, and psychological horror, with a retro visual aesthetic designed to evoke the characteristic graphics of the PlayStation 2, Dreamcast, and GameCube era. Set in the year 2016, the story takes place in a fictional neighborhood in the city of São Paulo, Brazil, and is presented as an indirect sequel to Terminal 81, released in 2023.

In 2016, Eduardo 'Edi' Ventura, a young Uruguayan, embarks on a journey to the fictional neighborhood of Terminal 81 in Brazil, hoping to find his sister, who ran away from home years ago to escape their abusive grandfather. Upon arrival, Edi discovers a vibrant, exotic, and lively neighborhood that, beneath its lively surface, hides dark and disturbing secrets.

As the days go by, Edi begins to see through the deceptive facade of Terminal 81. What initially seems like a vibrant neighborhood is revealed to be a grim place marked by insecurity, social inequality, violence, and vice. In this hostile environment, a dangerous criminal organization dedicated to human trafficking operates, abducting and exploiting young women. Edi must follow the clues about this group to uncover the truth and reunite with his missing sister.

Step into Terminal 81, connect with its unique characters, follow the dictates of your moral compass, make crucial decisions, and uncover a unique ending shaped by your actions.

Game Features:

  • Moderate Length: 3 to 6 hours to complete the main story and explore every corner of the game, depending on the player's skill.

  • Free Exploration Map: Explore a lively neighborhood filled with restaurants, shops, nightclubs, parks, and much more in Terminal 81.

  • Atmospheric Immersion: A wide variety of sound and visual effects designed to immerse the player in the world of Terminal 81R.

  • Interactive Environment: Work to earn money, spend it in numerous ways, interact with and get to know characters, play minigames, attend events, and live the experience your way.

  • Multiple Endings: The player's decisions will significantly impact the narrative, leading to varied and surprising outcomes.

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Ubuntu 20.04, Ubuntu 18.04, and CentOS 7
  • Processor: x64 architecture with SSE2 instruction set support
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: OpenGL 3.2+, Vulkan capable
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
